CatDescriptText: Phyllis Tredennick, unemployed secretary, Johnstown and Reuben Taylor, porter, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 19, 1962, pg. 9 with question: "Do you think that, eventually, the City of Pittsburgh will come to include the outlying suburbs under a metropolitan plan of government?"  Ms. Tredennick's answer reads: "I guess it depends on what the people want.  I haven't given the matter too much thought yet."  Mr. Taylor's answer reads: "It would be good if the city could grow in that respect. With more money coming in from all these areas, taxes might be lower."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Phyllis Tredennick wearing hair net and eyeglasses, standing on sidewalk with female journalist on left, and telephone booth in background; Portrait of Reuben Taylor wearing fedora and striped jacket, standing on sidewalk in front of store window with sign that reads "Rain Jacket $1.87" and "Casting Reel $3.99"
